required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Metabolic Balance Study of Apraglutide in Patients With SBS-IF and Colon-in-Continuity
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open-label, Metabolic Balance Study to Evaluate the Effects of Apraglutide on Intestinal Absorption in Adult Subjects With Short Bowel Syndrome, Intestinal Failure (SBS-IF), and Colon-in-Continuity (CIC)

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of the trial is to evaluate the efficacy of apraglutide in increasing intestinal energy absorption in relation to metabolic balance assessments.

detailed_description.textblock: This is an international, multicenter trial to evaluate the change in absolute energy absorption over metabolic balance periods of apraglutide in adult subjects with SBS-IF and CIC. The active pharmaceutical ingredient is apraglutide, an investigational GLP-2 analogue. The trial consists of an evaluation period of 52 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in absolute energy absorption assessed by the difference between oral intake and excretion
primary_outcome.description: Assessed by bomb calorimetry Units: Cal/gr

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative change from baseline in actual weekly PS volume
Absolute change from baseline in actual weekly PS volume
Subjects who achieve a reduction of at least 1 day per week of PS
Clinical responders (20% reduction of PS volume from baseline)
Subjects reaching enteral autonomy as assessed by the need or reduction of parenteral support requirements.
Energy reduction in the Parenteral Nutrition as assessed by parenteral support calorie content
Relative change in absorption of energy derived as the difference between oral intake and excretion.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline at week 4 and at week 48

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative change in absorption of carbohydrate derived as the difference between oral intake and excretion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline at week 4 and at week 48

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative change in absorption of nitrogen derived as the difference between oral intake and excretion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline at week 4 and at week 48

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative change in absorption of lipid derived as the difference between oral intake and excretion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline at week 4 and at week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by modified Van de Kamer titration technique

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in absolute absorption of energy over metabolic balance periods to assess changes in nutrient absorption of intestinal output
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline at week 4 and at week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by bomb calorimetry Units: Cal/day

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in absolute absorption of carbohydrate, over metabolic balance periods
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline at week 4 and at week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by Englyst's method Units: kJ/day

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in absolute absorption of nitrogen, over metabolic balance periods
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline at week 4 and at week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by Kjeldahl's method Units: kJ/day

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in absolute absorption of lipid, over metabolic balance periods
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline at week 4 and at week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by modified Van de Kamer titration technique Units: kJ/day

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in urine output over metabolic balance periods.
Changes in urinary sodium as assessed by flame photometry
Changes in urinary potassium as assessed by flame photometry
Changes in urinary calcium as assessed by atomic absorption spectrometry
Changes in urinary magnesium as assessed by atomic absorption spectrometry

intervention.description: Apraglutide is a synthetic peptide analogue of GLP-2 under development for treatment of SBS-IF, which acts as a full agonist at the GLP-2 receptor with in vitro potency and selectivity comparable with native GLP-2.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed consent for this trial prior to any trial specific assessment.
- Male and female subjects with SBS-IF and CIC, receiving parenteral support (PS), secondary to surgical resection of the small intestine with <200 cm from duodenojejunal flexure.
- Subject must require PS at least 2 days per week and be considered stable.
- No restorative surgery intended to change PS requirements in the trial period.
- Age â‰¥18 years at screening.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy or lactation.
- Body mass index equal or higher than 30 kg/m2 at the time of screening.
- Major abdominal surgery in the last 6 months prior to screening.
